content: dover toque pattern by method knitting skill level beginner/advanced beginner materials 16 circular knitting needles us 11 8mm 16 circular knitting needles us 13 9mm darning needle or crochet hook scissors yarn any size 6 super bulky yarn approximately 70yds recommended brands malabrigo rasta lion brand thick and quick loops and threads cozy wool size average adult - measures ~7 5 wide by 8 5 tall notes - please read through the entire pattern and notes before you begin - this pattern is worked in the round from the bottom up - if you want the fit a tad looser size up your needles to a 9mm for the brim and 10mm for the body - once you reach the stitch marker on every round slip it over to the right needle - in the fs flower stitch keep your loop stitches not too tight to avoid creating too big of a hole at the bottom of your flower i like to give them a little tug out before doing the next stitch - i personally do not switch to dpns for decreases but do whatever feels comfortable for you - to create a basic knit stitch toque ignore the fs instructions in row 11 & 12 17 &18 and 23 & 24 simply knit all the way around for those row and you will have yourself a cute fitted toque with no embellishments abbreviations co cast on st s stitches p purl k2tog knit next 2 stitches together k knit ktbl knit through back loop fs flower stitch count 2 stitches to the left and 3 stitches down and insert right needle through the middle of that stitch wrap yarn as you normally would a normal stitch and pull the loop through to the front of the work keeping it a bit loose this is your first flower petal knit 2 stitches insert right needle through same hole as the first petal wrap yarn as a normal stitch pulling the loop through to the front of your work keeping the stitch nice and loose this is your second petal knit 2 stitches insert right needle through the same hole again wrap yarn as normal stitch pull loop through keeping it loose 3rd petal pattern brim using size 11 8mm circular needles co 40 stitches using the long-tail cast-on method being careful not to twist your stitches place stitch marker then start to knit row 1 directly into the first co stitch effectively joining in the round rounds 1-6 *ktbl1 p1* repeat from * to * to end of round 40 sts body *switch to size 13 9mm circular needles round 7 k all stitches 40 sts round 8 k all stitches round 9 k all stitches round 10 k all stitches round 11 k1 fs k6 fs k6 fs k6 fs k5 52 sts on needles round 12 *k2tog k1 k2tog k1 k2tog k5* repeat from * to * 4 times total 40 sts round 13 k all stitches
